transcript.text: well the most famous that I know of was
sort of
fun back in uh
1990 I got a letter from a group called
a punk R group
called um Bad Religion great graffin
yeah I like the name so they asked me if
I would U talk for 8 minutes about the
the invasion of Iraq at that time nobody
was you couldn't say a word about it you
know literally was banned like North
Korea but so I thought okay I didn't
have any way to do it they sent me a
tape and somebody had a tape recorder so
took the tape and I talked for eight
minutes and I mailed it back to them and
a while little while they sent me a 45
in record with my 8 minut on one side
and uh what they called an anti war song
on the other side I couldn't make head
or tail out of the anti war song so I
sent it to a friend who had a
14-year-old daughter and she wrote me
back a lengthy disquisition on the
meaning of the song in the popular
culture so but I later discover I mean
you know when I give talks people want
books on for years the main thing that
people wanted signed all over the world
was that record
